title: How to Write the Greek Alphabet

steps.title: Write down the 24 letters of the Greek alphabet in order.
steps.content: Write down the 24 letters of the Greek alphabet in order. [1] Write both the capital letters and the small letters (the list below shows the capital letters first): [1] X Research source Α α = Alpha (al-fah) [2] X Research source Β β = Beta (bay-tah) Γ γ = Gamma (ga-mah) [3] X Research source Δ δ = Delta (del-tah) Ε ε = Epsilon (ep-si-lon) Ζ ζ = Zeta (zay-tah) Η η = Eta (ay-tah) Θ θ = Theta (thay-tah) Ι ι = Iota (eye-o-tah) Κ κ = Kappa (kap-pah) [4] X Research source Λ λ = Lambda (lamb-dah) Μ μ = Mu (mew) Ν ν = Nu (new) Ξ ξ = Xi (zie) Ο ο = Omicron (om-e-cron) Π π = Pi (pie) Ρ ρ = Rho (row) [5] X Research source Σ σ = Sigma (sig-mah) Τ τ = Tau (taw) Υ υ = Upsilon (up-si-lon) Φ φ = Phi (fy) Χ χ = Chi (chy) Ψ ψ = Psi (sy) Ω ω = Omega (o-meh-ga)

steps.title: Practice learning four to six letters per day.
steps.content: Practice learning four to six letters per day. [6] X Research source Say them out loud, in order. [7] X Research source Write them down (don't forget to write both capital and small letters). Create flashcards with the letter on one side and the name of the letter on the other. Practice until you know them without thinking. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Each day, add four to six more letters.
steps.content: Each day, add four to six more letters. Continue to say them, write them, use them for spelling. Don't forget to include the letters you learned previously!

steps.title: By the end of four to six days, you will have learned the entire Greek alphabet.
steps.content: By the end of four to six days, you will have learned the entire Greek alphabet. But to get them into your long-term memory, you will have practice at least once a day (e.g. saying them in order, then in reverse order; going through your flashcards) for about a week, and then maybe once a week after that.
